p: Unlike the leaves and flowers, there is less scientific data on the composition of essential oils obtained from L. camara fruits and stems. The composition of fruit essential oils seems to vary a lot as palmitic acid was the major constituent in south China (22.5%) [ 15] and Northern India (22.8%) [ 10], while that compound was absent from Ivorian samples from Adzope and Toumodi, which contained high proportions of ( E)-β-caryophyllene and α-humulene [ 24]. Stem essential oils were dominated by germacrene D (31%) in south China [ 15] and by palmitic acid (32.7%) in Northern India [ 10]. Moreover, one fruit sample (August, second period) showed a different profile due to the high quantity of neral and geranial, which were not present in the fruit essential oils of Northern India.
